There is a 24/7 small supermarket just at the crossroad with the road to

There are few hotels and one hostel in this town. "Zugdidi Hostel" is located 10-15 min walking from the city center and bus/train station. You could find here tips for traveling, soft beds, vineyard, cozy old Asian atmosphere and funny staff, also tours in a region and maps. Moreover "Zugdidi Hostel" is a place for gathering, parties, good time, storytelling and Georgian wine tasting. Prices in a hostel are between 15-25 lari, (Georgian Gel). Bed in a dorm-20 Gel, bed in a single or in a double room - 25 Gel per person, if there are more than 4 people in a dorm - 15 Gel. Here is free wi-fi tea and coffee. You could contact "Zugdidi Hostel" by phone +995591654036 or via email: zugdidihostel@gmail.com. For more information please look at www.zugdidihostel.com
It can be hard to find Wi-Fi access in town, except in a few cafés.

value: , take the 21h10 night train reaching Zugdidi at 6h25. From Zugdidi, take the marshrutka to

waiting outside the train station. Marshrutka ticket price: 15 Lari (Georgians) / 20 Lari (foreigners). Duration: about 4 hours + an unpredictable waiting time in Zugdidi (until the marshrutka is full), that can be up to 7 or 8 hours, especially in low season (hence 12 hours in total).
: at least one marshrutka per day.
